page.title: 03Tracy Park Golf Course
page.content: {Kelvin Aitken}is a qualified golf professional. He has been for four years. Kelvin has travelled the country playing golf, and next year is going to play in America. At Tracy Park Country Club, he teaches people to play. He also works in the golf shop part time as a salesman. His day starts at 8.45 when he practices his golf for hours, then taking lessons after. He charges Â£4 for half an hour and Â£8 for an hour. There are approximately 550 golf members at Tracy Park. They pay Â£165 a year to play on the golf course. Non members also play for the price of Â£6 on a week day and Â£8 on the weekend. Next year it will have 27 holes instead of 18 holes.
